mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The houses have been regarded as some of the earliest and finest examples of Queen Anne architecture in the city. They were built in 1878 and added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1980. 16 Claremont Street is home to the George Perkins Marsh Institute of Clark University. The Marsh Institute studies the human dimensions of environmental change and coupled natural and human systems. ... 18 Claremont Street is now the Jeanne X. Kasperson Library of Clark University. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norcross_Brothers_Houses [work]
